article: Certainly dustmen prefer to be known as "Reuse Collection and Disposal Officers". You may think that this is rather _ , and it is better to call a spade a spade. But dustmen can be as _ as people of any other occupation, though we must _ that their job is not a _ one in the world. We often take dustmen for granted. Perhaps because they usually come very early in the morning, before most people are _ .We are likely to forget their _ .Our dustbins are _ regularly, but we _ stop to think about the men who do this. However, it is one of the most important jobs in the world, and when there are no dustmen to take away the rubbish, the general _ soon becomes aware that something is wrong. Recently, the dustmen of England went on strike for higher wages. During the first few days it was regarded as a _ .But when the first two weeks had passed, and the dustbins were overflowing in nearly every backyard in the country, the joke did not seem so _ any more. _ the strike continued, people could not _ the hills of rubbish around their dustbins, and they looked for other places in which to get rid of it. Even Leicester Square, in the heart of West End of London, was _ high with plastic bags full of smelly rubbish. This was a(n) _ attraction that the people of London were not at all _ to see. Even when the strike was over, it took several weeks for the country to get cleaned up completely. Perhaps now the English people appreciate the work of _ dustmen rather more _ and won't take them for granted any more.
